snippet: The Standard & Poor’s/Case-Shiller 20-city home price index rose 4.6 percent in January compared with 12 months earlier, S.&P. said.. That is up from growth of 4.4 percent in December.
abstract: Standard & Poor’s/Case-Shiller 20-city home price index rises 4.6 percent in January from year-earlier period; increase continues steady rise in home prices as housing market deals with affordability issues and fewer available properties.
lead_paragraph: The Standard & Poor’s/Case-Shiller 20-city home price index rose 4.6 percent in January compared with 12 months earlier, S.&P. said.. That is up from growth of 4.4 percent in December.

headline.main: Home Prices Maintain Steady, if Modest, Upward Trajectory
headline.print_headline: Home Prices Maintain Steady, if Modest, Upward Trajectory

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Standard & Poor's Case-Shiller Home Price Index
